Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant qualifies for refugee protection under sections 96 or 97 of IRPA
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant faced threats and assaults by MS due to perceived police affiliation; evidence shows specific targeting
Decision_Outcome: RPD's decision is unreasonable; claim remitted for re-determination
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate personal risk linked to Convention grounds
Credibility_Factor: Perceived affiliation with police leading to targeted violence
Legal_Rule: Section 96: Persecution based on Convention grounds; Section 97: Risk-based protection for personal danger
Procedural_Issue: RPD failed to properly assess personalized risk versus generalized country conditions
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by MS and Salvadoran police due to perceived state affiliation
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim not determined on merits yet; matter remitted
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RPD's analysis found flawed in distinguishing specific vs. generalized risk
Key_Evidence_Considered: Threats and assaults by MS, perceived police links, lack of state protection
Legal_Framework: Refugee and humanitarian protection under IRPA
Applicant_Challenge: RPD incorrectly characterized risks as generalized
Outcome: Claim remitted to RPD for re-determination
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board (IRB), Federal Court
